glossentry.glossdef: Input/Output is a handler to handle the incoming and outgoing traffic.

Immediate Event Charging is used for direct debit service. In IEC, a single transaction is used where a defined amount is reduced from the subscriber account by the OCF after completing the credit authorization.

The Internet Engineering Task Force develops and promotes Internet standards and deals with standards of the Internet protocol suite. It is an organization for open standards with no formal membership requirement.
An NCC CNF that includes both the SM and ME functions, integrated into a single CNF.
International Mobile Equipment Id and its Software Version is an unique identifier for mobile phones and various software versions.
IP Multimedia Subsystem is an architectural framework to deliver IP multimedia services to end users.
International Mobile Subscriber Identity is a unique number to identify the Global System for Mobile Communication (GSM) subscriber.
The ingress controller manages Ingress, which exposes HTTP and HTTPS routes from outside the cluster to services within the cluster.
If the calling party and called party are part of the same closed user group, then the call is an In-Group call and the calling charge is defined accordingly.
Input/Output Handler for Diameter. Handles the ingress/egress traffic for 4G Diameter messages.
Internet Protocol is a layer three protocol that enables two devices to communicate by sending or receiving data packets and allows selection of the best network path.
IP Connectivity Access Network is an interface that provides IP communication between end points.
Istio is an open source service mesh designed to make it easier to connect, manage and secure traffic between, and obtain telemetry about microservices running in containers.

Interactive Voice Response is a technology that enables a computer to interact with humans through the use of voice and DTMF tones input through keypad. IVR enables customers to interact with the host system of an organization through a telephone keypad or by speech recognition, after which they can resolve their own queries by following the IVR dialogue. IVR systems can respond with prerecorded or dynamically generated audio to direct users.
